t: Psalm 139
God’s Omnipresence and Omniscience.
For the choir director. A Psalm of David.
O*pn Lord,*s You have searched me and known me.*i
You*ln know when I sit down and when I rise up; You*ln understand my thought from afar.
You*ln scrutinize my path and my lying down, And*ln are intimately acquainted with all my ways.
Even*ln before there is a word on my tongue, Behold,*ln O Lord,*s You know it all.
You*ln have enclosed me behind and before, And*ln laid Your hand upon me.
Such*iln knowledge is too wonderful for me; It*ln is too*i high, I cannot attain to it.
Where*ln can I go from Your Spirit? Or*ln where can I flee from Your presence?
If*ln I ascend to heaven, You are there; If*ln I make my bed in Sheol, behold, You are there.
If*ln I take the wings of the dawn, If*ln I dwell in the remotest part of the sea,
Even*ln there Your hand will lead me, And*ln Your right hand will lay hold of me.
If*ln I say, “Surely the darkness will overwhelm me, And*ln the light around me will be night,”
Even*ln the darkness is not dark to You, And*ln the night is as bright as the day. Darkness*ln and light are alike to*i You.*i
For*ln You formed my inward parts; You*ln wove me in my mother’s womb.
I*ln will give thanks to You, for I am fearfully and wonderfully made; Wonderful*ln are Your works, And*ln my soul knows it very well.
My*ln frame was not hidden from You, When*ln I was made in secret, And*iln skillfully wrought in the depths of the earth;
Your*ln eyes have seen my unformed substance; And*ln in Your book were all written The*ln days that were ordained for*i me,*i When*ln as yet there was not one of them.
How*ln precious also are Your thoughts to me, O God! How*ln vast is the sum of them!
If*ln I should count them, they would outnumber the sand. When*ln I awake, I am still with You.
O*ln that You would slay the wicked, O God; Depart*ln from me, therefore, men of bloodshed.
For*ln they speak against You wickedly, And*ln Your enemies take Your*i name*i in vain.
Do*ln I not hate those who hate You, O Lord?*s And*ln do I not loathe those who rise up against You?
I*ln hate them with the utmost hatred; They*ln have become my enemies.
Search*ln me, O God, and know my heart; Try*ln me and know my anxious thoughts;
And*ln see if there be any hurtful way in me, And*ln lead me in the everlasting way.
